intro: Corydalis orthoceras var. latifoliolata, commonly known as the broad-leaf corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 15-30 cm, with slender stems and trifoliate leaves that have broad, lance-shaped leaflets. It prefers well-drained, loamy soils and thrives in partial to full shade, making it a suitable ornamental plant for woodland gardens. Its flowering period usually occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a touch of color to shaded landscapes.
